comment: I’ve been writing and developing predictive models for decades, remember Jerome Friedman’s change on decision trees back in days, then I was involved in writing some feedback loops for some stochastic models back in 2010. Each time there where an insane value in using some new nuances of predictive modeling, but still, a model that just in its core is predicting the next word like gpt could become what it turned out do be it just incredible. A lot of cudos to the ppl at openAI that had the foresight and grit to pursue these language models.

comment:
Statistics are not automatically neutral, and can be  cherry picked to make different arguments.

So it is important that statistics and scientific and medical studies are open about having  how the results have been reached, and what is unknown.

Many books especially follow a theory without having to provide research into whether their statistics are based on correlation or causation. Lex's reference to books on relative intelligence perhaps needs to pass that benchmark.

author: @xjaskix

comment:
Difficult time believing these two well meaning guys are quite so naive.

You can align all you want & even if you achieve  whatever one might call “perfect” (unlikely even if you could define it) the challenge is as much human nature & you aren’t going to align that.

Sure AI can do many wonderful things for society but the idea that it’s not going to be misused if it isn’t regulated is just flat out silly. 

In the meantime Google & Microsoft are at each others throats in an AI battle that could literally sink one or the other if one of them gets it wrong. 

It’s ludicrous to believe that all AI releases are going to be safe under those circumstances.

To believe that it’s evolution is always going to take place at a nice human pace so that we can adjust or that no state actors are going to weaponize it, is equally myopic. 

I am not anti AI. It has great promise. 

But we as a society are no more ready for it than we were for elections being won with social media disinformation or the manipulation of human behaviour through the intentional creation of anger .

The people who are going to control this (while they can) are !not the lab guys, the creative geniuses. It will be the boardrooms and the situation rooms. 
 
If we don’t get that, we have learned nothing about our current society.

If we make something like a autistic servant, who knows the answer, but cannot describe the reasoning behind it, then we will have fail.

author: @bananawarriorwootwoot

comment: ​ @miguelcarvalho9551 , It's good to think about potential dangers. But dismissing a technology with a Hollywood doomsday scenario is detrimental to the evolution of civilization. It'd be like being scared of sewing machines in the 1800s. Autoregressive LLMs like GPT are in no way, shape, or form capable of consciousness, sentience, or at least a traditional description of them. I've been studying consciousness to program it during my AI research but it's an inherently quantum mechanic phenomenon. Even if we achieve sentience, singularity, etc. it is essential to understand that intellect doesn't always mean intolerance. And unconscious tools like GPT would be genuinely useful to bridge the IQ gap when we have truly sentient AI.

comment:
2:14:00 if you really want to know contact me in some appropriate way (perhaps comment on a video on my channel so I am more likely to see it than if you just reply back to me here, which I don’t always get notified about). I’m not that hard to find. 

What you’re looking for is the Logic of the Universe (the Universal Explanation and the Foundation of Reasoning) and it is a concept known as the Logos in ancient philosophy (but the formal proof for it that humans have written has historically been weak and too uncertain, and too well ignored or too easily lost, when it has occasionally been written by a great philosopher) but it is a self evident truth anyhow (as the Logos is a complete and self evident Logic, and is the Essence of Reason itself, the Substance of Logic). 

The arguments I have, and the details I know about the Logos and the universe are extensive but to give you an idea of one of the many ways my Universal Logic Theory (my “Theory of Everything”) puts counter arguments in a “checkmate” position is that even if someone provided a better explanation for the Origin of the Universe than I can, that would still merely be a more coherent and comprehensive understanding of the Universal Logic (the Explanation of the Universe, as well as the Source of Knowledge and Method of Reasoning)  by definition. So it is like how if I said “your cars are your cars” you could get all the newer and nicer cars you want and your cars would still be your cars and any cars that are not your cars would still be cars that are not your cars. 

So too is it with the One True God, the Universal Logic (that when applied to the physical universe is also the framework that equates to the sought after Unified Theory in physics) who is not a false god (something that is not actually the True God) or any kind of flawed or incomplete logic that cannot prove itself to be flawless, it is the Flawless Logic that governs the universe and that has demanded everything be everything (and nothing be nothing) which has led to our existence and the existence of everything around us and everything in the universe (physical/formal or metaphysical/substantive). 

To give anyone that reads this a taste of what an understanding of the Logos can do for us as a Unified Theory, we can use an understanding of the dynamic harmony of the universe and the dynamic exchange between the physical and metaphysical realms to build energy transduction systems that transduce formless energy from “the metaphysical substance of energy” (a rational aka real and sensible concept that is highly connected to the Logos, the Set of Underlying Principles) into physical/formal energy like electricity that can be used in our physical reality and be drawn from the Root Source, an Infinite Source of Energy. 

These are all things that are feasible and can be achieved through an understanding of the Logos (the Universal Logic) and devotion to Reason (the Logos), and while I can do and have done much of my work alone and without funding of any kind, those are many of the things I cannot do alone and without significant cooperation (from institutions and governments) and significant funding, but which I would love to help manifest and develop if others are interested and see the potential of these ideas.

author: @bbsara0146

comment:
"So, I was listening to a podcast the other day with Lex Fridman and Sam Altman. And I have to say, those two are just so smart, it's almost intimidating. I mean, they're like the Batman and Robin of Silicon Valley. But you know what they say, 'With great intelligence comes great responsibility.' And I think that responsibility includes not making the rest of us feel dumb all the time!

I mean, I love listening to their conversations, but sometimes I feel like I need a PhD just to understand what they're talking about. It's like they're speaking a different language! But hey, at least they're not doing it on purpose, right? They're just trying to share their knowledge with the world. And I appreciate that. I really do. Because as they say, 'The more you know, the more you realize how much you don't know.'

[The punchline is a play on the famous quote "With great power comes great responsibility" from the Spiderman comics. The comedian is suggesting that Lex Fridman and Sam Altman's intelligence is a form of power, and that they have a responsibility to not make the rest of us feel inferior. The joke also plays on the idea of intellectual humility, which is the idea that the more you know, the more you realize how much you don't know.]
author: @bomicbon

comment:
An automatic door is conscious AI. It does something with intention in reaction to stimulus.
Self-awareness of its own consciousness is the AGI-consciousness threshold.

Consciousness isn't self-awareness; it's not a paradox that invents itself. To have self-awareness of a 'thing' it has to already exist so you can notice that it's there so consciousness has to precede self-awareness.

Selection of people should be based-on and representative-of the spectrum of human personality traits.

There is direct evidence of lab enhancement in the SARS-CoV-2 genome. The FCS alteration and subsequent affinity for hACE2 could not evolve in bats and is clearly an artificial insert.
There is no question whatsoever it was the result of GoF. Anyone claiming otherwise is a liar.
Natural evolution scenarios become preposterous when you try to account for a pre-existing affinity for hACE2 without first infecting humans.
The open questions about SARS-CoV-2, are things like was it an orchestrated program to produce a delivery vehicle for a biological weapons program?

You ignore people with hate and focus on making things better. If no one knows there's group differences then no one looks into why and then no one works to remove lead from our environment. No one works on childhood nutrition because no one knows there's a problem.
Fear over what ignorant people are going to say is stupid. Do not empower that stupidity.
